sections: Tomorrow, Friday, March 17 at 4 pm ET (1 pm PT),

’s paid supporting subscribers will get exclusive access to a live discussion about the Silicon Valley Bank collapse with U.S. Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.); Cornell Law School Professor Saule Omarova, a Biden nominee blocked by the Senate because she has supported financial regulation; and Matt Stoller, director of research at the American Economic Liberties Project and a former Senate budget analyst.

The group will discuss the industry lobbying and deregulation that led to this development, the state of financial markets moving forward, and what reforms can be implemented to prevent future bank collapses. There will also be an opportunity for live questions from the audience.
